description: Str 13, dragon, fly speed 20, Hover, Power Attack, size Large or larger.
name: Prerequisites

description: The animated breath makes slam attacks accord- ing to its Hit Dice.
name: Attacks

description: The animated breath has no good saves. All of its save bonuses are 1/3 of its Hit Dice plus the appropriate abil-ity modifier.
name: Saves

description: The animated breath has no Constitution or Intelligence score. Its Wisdom and Charisma scores areboth 1. Its Strength and Dexterity vary by size:
name: Abilities

description: The assumed form can have no more Hit Dice than you have, to a maximum of 20Hit Dice. Your Strength and Constitution in the new formare above the average for the race or species into whichyou transform; your Strength is the average for the crea-ture +8, and your Constitution is the average for the crea-ture +2. Enervating Breath
name: Aspolymorph, except as follows

description: d12. Requirements To qualify to become a bloodscaled fury, a dragon must fulfill all the following criteria.
name: Hit Die

description: Rage: The dragon must have some sort of rage ability, most commonly derived from levels in the barbarian class, and must be able to enter this rage at least three times per day .
name: Special

description: The dragon must have the frightful presence ability . Class Skills The bloodscaled fury’s class skills (and the key ability for eachskill) are Climb (Str), Intimidate (Cha), Jump (Str), Listen(Wis), Swim (Str), Spot (Wis), and Survival (Wis). See Chap-ter 4: Skills in the Player’s Handbook for skill descriptions.
name: Frightful Presence

description: 2 + Int modifier.CHAPTER 2: A DM’S GUIDE TO DRAGONS A bloodscaled furyClass Features The following are class features of the bloodscaled fury pres-tige class.
name: Skill Points at Each Level

description: d8. Requirements To qualify to become a discipleof Ashardalon, a dragon must ful-fill all the following criteria.
name: Hit Die

description: 4 + Int modifier. Class Features The following are class features of the disciple of Ashar- dalon prestige class.
name: Skill Points at Each Level

description: d8. Requirements To qualify to become a dispassionate watcher, a dragon mustfulfill all the following criteria.
name: Hit Die

description: 2 + Int modifier. Class Features The following are class features of the dispassionate watcherof Chronepsis prestige class.
name: Skill Points at Each Level

description: A dispassionate watcher gains Draconic Knowledge (see page 69) as a bonus feat. It uses itsdispassionate watcher level as an additional modifier on itsdraconic knowledge checks.
name: Draconic Knowledge

description: d12. Requirements To qualify to become a dragon ascen-dant, a dragon must fulfill all the follow-ing criteria.
name: Hit Die

description: Draconic Knowledge, Fast Heal- ing, Great Fortitude, Improved Speed,Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes.
name: Feats

description: d12. Requirements To qualify to become an elemental master, a dragon mustfulfill all the following criteria.
name: Hit Die

description: Elemental Attunement: The dragon must have an energy or elemental subtype, such as air, cold, earth, elec-tricity, fire, or water.
name: Special

description: 2 + Int modifier. Class Features The following are class features of the elemental masterprestige class.
name: Skill Points at Each Level

description: d10. Requirements To qualify to become a hidecarved dragon, a dragon mustfulfill all the following criteria.
name: Hit Die

description: 4 + Int modifier. Class Features The following are class features of thehidecarved dragon prestige class.
name: Skill Points at Each Level

description: d10.Requirements To qualify to become a sacred warder of Bahamut, a dragonmust fulfill all the following criteria.
name: Hit Die

description: 2 + Int modifier. Class Features The following are class features of the sacred warder ofBahamut prestige class.
name: Skill Points at Each Level

description: d10. Requirements To qualify to become an unholy ravager of Tiamat, a dragonmust fulfill all the following criteria.
name: Hit Die

description: Maximize Breath, Recover Breath, Tempest Breath.
name: Feats

description: 2 + Int modifier. Class Features The following are class features of the unholy ravager ofTiamat prestige class.
name: Skill Points at Each Level

description: An unholy ravager of Tiamat adds its class levels to its cleric levels to determine its bonus on damage when using its smite ability (the granted power of the Destruction domain). At 4th level, 8th level, and 12th level, an unholy ravager can use its smite ability one additional time per day .
name: Smite

description: An advanced dragon’s fly speed, maneuverability, land speed, and other special movement types (swim,burrow, and so on) do not change.
name: Speed

description: A great wyrm’s Strength and Constitu- tion scores both increase by 2 points for every virtual agecategory the dragon gains. Its Dexterity remainsunchanged. Its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charismaincrease by 2 points for every two virtual age categoriesthe dragon gains.
name: Ability Scores

description: A great wyrm’s sorcerer caster level increases by 2 for every virtual age category the dragongains.
name: Caster Level

description: Like ordinary dragons, advanced dragons receive one feat for every 4 Hit Dice they have. Any feats gainedafter the dragon reaches old age can be epic feats (see thedescriptions earlier in this chapter).
name: Feats

description: Improved Unarmed Strike, size Small or Medium.
name: Prerequisites

description: When your opponent is larger than Medium, you gain a circumstance bonus on your grapple check toescape a grapple or pin. The size of the bonus depends on your opponent’s size: Opponent Size Bonus Colossal +8 Gargantuan +6Huge +4 Large +2 CLOSE-QUARTERS FIGHTING [GENERAL] You are skilled at fighting at very close range and in evadinggrappling attempts.
name: Benefit

description: You can make an attack of opportunity when someone tries to grapple you, provided that you are not flat-footed or already grappled, even if the attacker has theimproved grab ability . Any damage you deal with your attack of opportunity applies as a bonus to the ensuing grapple check you make toavoid becoming grappled. This feat does not grant you anadditional attack of opportunity in a round, so the feat doesnot help you if you have no attacks of opportunity available.
name: Benefit

description: Improved Unarmed Strike, Clever Wrestling, size Small or Medium.
name: Prerequisites

description: When your opponent is larger than Medium, you gain a circumstance bonus on any opposed check youmake to avoid being bull rushed, tripped, knocked down,or pushed. The size of the bonus depends on your oppo-nent’s size: Opponent Size Bonus Colossal +8 Gargantuan +6Huge +4 Large +2
name: Benefit

description: This feat is effective against the Large and in Charge feat. The bonus from this feat does not stack withthe Clever Wrestling feat. DEFT STRIKE [GENERAL] You can place attacks at weak points in your opponent’sdefenses.
name: Special

description: Int 13, Combat Expertise, Spot 10 ranks, sneak attack +1d6.
name: Prerequisites

description: You gain a cohort selected from Table 3–14: Dragon Cohorts (page 139), just as you would by selectingthe Leadership feat. However, you may treat the dragon’sECL as if it were 3 lower than indicated. See Dragons as Cohorts, page 138, for more information. DRAGON FAMILIAR [GENERAL] When you are able to acquire a new familiar, you may selecta wyrmling dragon as a familiar.
name: Benefit

description: When acquiring a new familiar, you can choose a wyrmling dragon.See Dragons as Familiars, page 141, formore information. DRAGON HUNTER [GENERAL] You have made a special study of dragons and know how todefend against a dragon’s attacks.Prerequisite: Wis 13.
name: Benefit

description: You gain the service of a dragonnel (see page 150) as a steed. It serves loyally as long as you treat it fairly,much like a cohort.
name: Benefit

description: If you have a special mount (such as from the paladin class feature), this dragonnel replaces your specialmount. See Dragons as Special Mounts, page 139, for details. DRAGON WILD SHAPE [GENERAL] You can take the form of a dragon.
name: Special

description: Wis 19, Knowledge (nature) 15 ranks, wild shape ability .
name: Prerequisites

description: You may use a full-round action to make a single attack (melee or ranged) against a dragon with a +4 bonus onthe attack roll. Such an attack deals an extra 2d6 points ofdamage if it hits. For a ranged attack, the dragon must bewithin 30 feet to gain the bonus to hit and the extra damage.
name: Benefit

description: You gain a +4 bonus on Diplomacy checks made to adjust the attitude of a dragon, and a +2 bonus on Ridechecks made when you are mounted on a dragon. In addition, you gain a +4 bonus on saves against the frightful presence of good dragons.
name: Benefit

description: You can’t select this feat if you have already taken the Dragonthrall feat. DRAGONSONG [GENERAL] Your song or poetics echo the power of the dragonsong, anancient style of vocal performance created by dragons in thedistant past.
name: Special

description: Cha 13, Knowledge (arcana) 4 ranks, Per- form 6 ranks, Speak Language (Draconic).
name: Prerequisites

description: You gain a +2 bonus on Perform checks involv- ing song, poetics, or any other verbal or spoken form ofperformance. In addition, the DC of any saving throw required by mind-affecting effects based on your song or poetics (suchas bardic music) is increased by +2. DRAGONTHRALL [GENERAL] You have pledged your life to the service of evil dragonkind.
name: Benefit

description: You can’t select this feat if you have already taken the Dragonfriend feat. 105CHAPTER 3: THE PLAYER’S PERSPECTIVE106FRIGHTFUL PRESENCE [GENERAL] Like a dragon, your mere presence can terrify thosearound you.
name: Special

description: Close-Quarters Fighting, Power Attack, base attack bonus +6.
name: Prerequisites

description: Dragons can’t perceive one subject/ two levels.
name: Hide from Dragons

description: Dragons can’t perceive one subject/ two levels.
name: Hide from Dragons

description: You and your allies gain a bonus on saves against fear.
name: Cloak of Bravery

description: Allies gain bonus to AC and saves against dragons.
name: Antidragon Aura M

description: None (see the dracolyte prestige class, page 122).
name: Deities

description: Aasterinian, Astilabor, Bahamut, Chronepsis, Falazure, Garyx, Hlal, Io, Lendys, Tamara, Tiamat.
name: Deities

description: None (see the dracolyte prestige class, page 122).
name: Deities

description: You and your allies gain a bonus on saves against fear.
name: Cloak of Bravery

description: Subject gives caster what it’s holding.
name: Ench Entice Gift

description: Allies gain bonus to AC and saves against dragons.
name: Abjur Antidragon AuraM
